programme.title: Life in the shadow of Guatemala's Volcano of Fire
programme.desc: On 3 June, the Fuego volcano in Guatemala erupted, killing at least 113 people and leaving 332 missing. Thousands of victims have been displaced and are still living in temporary shelters.

programme.title: He died sitting on our front porch: the fight to stop Chicago's gang killings
programme.desc: Over the Fourth of July weekend, over 100 people were shot in Chicago – a worrying increase after the city’s murder rate had fallen to its lowest level in 40 years.

programme.title: Someone Else's War

programme.title: United Voices
programme.desc: As work in the UK gets more precarious and the gig economy booms, trade unionism is being reimagined and people from a wide range of backgrounds are joining new kinds of unions, often for the first time.

programme.title: Born in Damascus: the legacy of Syria's war for two separated cousins
programme.desc: Laura, a Scottish-Syrian film-maker, reconnects online with her closest cousin Lujain after 10 years apart. Their paths were separated by war, and now Laura hopes to reconstruct a positive image of the past by sharing memories and family videos with Lujain, who fled to Canada.

programme.desc: Damien Gayle, a Guardian environment correspondent, follows a group of climate activists as they try to paralyse the UK's fossil fuel distribution network. programme.desc: Over the Fourth of July weekend, over 100 people were shot in Chicago – a worrying increase after the city’s murder rate had fallen to its lowest level in 40 years.

programme.title: Guantánamo Diary | The quest for the perfect male six-packs
programme.desc: Guantánamo Diary: rendition, torture and detention without charge | Steroids, syringes and stigma: the quest for the perfect male six-packs

programme.title: Italian mafia’s cocaine trafficking leaves trail of drug devastation among poor of Brazil
programme.desc: The all-powerful Calabrian crime syndicate 'Ndrangheta has forged a deadly network of drug trafficking routes through Brazil – 80% of all cocaine arriving in Europe comes through the country's Santos port.

programme.title: Programming will resume shortly
programme.desc: We're catching up on our beauty sleep! Stay tuned for more priceless entertainment curated by Rakuten TV.

programme.title: Inside a long Covid clinic | My year of long Covid
programme.desc: Inside a long Covid clinic: ’I look normal, but my body is breaking down’ | ‘The pandemic isn’t over’: my year of long Covid

programme.title: On the Ukraine frontline | 'A resort of ghosts': on the Ukraine frontline
programme.desc: On the Ukraine frontline: 'Only the dead aren't afraid' | 'A resort of ghosts': on the Ukraine frontline waiting for war again

programme.title: The Syrian spaceman who became a refugee | Netflix fans uncover the real life of Pablo Escobar
programme.desc: The Syrian spaceman who became a refugee | Narcotours: Netflix fans uncover the real life of Pablo Escobar

programme.title: Anonymous Comes to Town
programme.desc: The sleepy rustbelt town of Steubenville, Ohio, was once best known for high school sports and as the birthplace of Dean Martin.

programme.title: Ireland's forgotten mixed-race child abuse victims
programme.desc: Rosemary Adaser was one of many mixed-race children considered illegitimate who was brought up in institutions run by the Catholic church in Ireland between the 1950s and 1970s.

programme.title: Life in the Arctic | The poets taking on climate change
programme.desc: Life in the Arctic: how climate change is killing a culture | High ice and hard truth: the poets taking on climate change

programme.title: Why is anti-immigration sentiment on the rise in Canada?
programme.desc: Canada has long been celebrated for its welcoming stance towards immigrants, fostering a prosperous, multicultural society. But in recent years, rising concerns over living costs and housing shortages have fueled a mounting scepticism of the country’s mass immigration policies.

programme.title: A new normal
programme.desc: With much uncertainty and fear around Covid-19, journalist Iman Amrani asks the Guardian community what they want life to look like after lockdown. From the environment to working and relationships, this video series will look at how we can positively shape a new normal

programme.title: Cancer Town
programme.desc: 'People are dying horrible deaths': the Louisiana town where cancer haunts the streets | Rev William Barber visits town at heart of Guardian campaign

programme.title: Death land
programme.desc: Hello, I have death anxiety | he death doula: helping you prepare for the day you die

programme.title: The Guardian Cities - Divided Cities
programme.desc: Divided Cities: Does Melilla really need a Trump-style wall? | Why Havana's taxi drivers massively outearn doctors | There’s food… it’s just not real food

programme.title: Why?
programme.desc: Why your memories can't be trusted | Why we should be paying more for parking

programme.title: Europeans
programme.desc: France: 'Where's the democracy in that?' | Germany: What lies ahead is the past

programme.title: America's soccer migrants: the US footballers crossing Mexico's border
programme.desc: Despite President Donald Trump’s rhetoric about Mexicans crossing the border to the US, American soccer players such as Omar Gonzalez are heading south for new opportunities, more money and a better standard of football.

programme.title: Desert Fire
programme.desc: Football’s world cup for unrecognised territories is viewed through the eyes of the manager and players of one of the most fascinating teams, Iraqi Kurdistan.

programme.title: Can women save sumo? The crossroads facing Japan's national sport
programme.desc: The ancient Japanese sport of sumo is in well-documented crisis. Years of controversy and scandal have hurt the sport's ability to attract new talent.

programme.title: Radical Brownies
programme.desc: Berets, badges, Black Lives Matter and social justice: the youth group for activist girls of colour.

programme.title: Marielle and Monica: the LGBT activists resisting Bolsonaro's Brazil
programme.desc: The LGBT activists resisting Bolsonaro's Brazil. Marielle Franco, a Brazilian LGBT and human rights activist, was killed in March 2018.

programme.title: Dearborn, Michigan
programme.desc: In the last 12 months the city of Dearborn, Michigan, has been thrown into conflict. At its heart, the conflict is about fear, ideology and identity politics – and what it means to be an American.

programme.title: Flat Earth: meet the people casting aside 2,500 years of science
programme.desc: Though not a new phenomenon, flat Earth theory has enjoyed a huge resurgence recently.

programme.title: Abortion in Mexico | The women protesting Poland's new abortion law
programme.desc: Abortion in Mexico: Catholics, the law and the right to choose | 'Sex is not a crime': the women protesting Poland's new abortion law

programme.title: The Hour of Lynching - vigilante violence in India
programme.desc: Rakbar, a Muslim dairy farmer, was murdered by a Hindu mob who thought he was taking a cow to be slaughtered for meat.

programme.title: The Climate and the Cross
programme.desc: An internal battle is simmering among US Christians over whether climate change is a call to protect the Earth, the work of God to be welcomed, or does not exist at all.

programme.title: Somali Night Fever
programme.desc: In the 1970s and 80s Mogadishu's airwaves were filled with Somali funk, disco, soul and reggae.

programme.title: Super Dogs | The remarkable urban photographs of David Levene
programme.desc: Super dogs: the race to win America’s most famous dog show | City: the remarkable urban photographs of David Levene

programme.title: Love Jihad: India's lethal religious conspiracy theory
programme.desc: The mutilated body of a 24-year-old Muslim, Arbaaz Aftab Mullah, was discovered on a railway track near his home.

programme.title: Gay, black and HIV positive: America's hidden epidemic
programme.desc: If you are a black, gay man in America, your risk of contracting HIV is one in two. Leah Green travels to Atlanta, Georgia, which has the largest gay and black community in the country. She finds out how stigma, education and structural racism continue to feed into this startling statistic

programme.title: We Walk Together
programme.desc: Thousands of refugees were sleeping rough at Budapest’s Keleti station, waiting for trains to take them to western Europe. Then, they just got up and walked.

programme.title: Globalised slavery: how big supermarkets are selling prawns in supply chain fed by slave labour
programme.desc: A six-month Guardian multimedia investigation has, for the first time, tracked how some of the world's big-supermakets are using suppliers relying on slave labour to put cheap prawns on their shelves. Slavery is back and here's the proof. Narrated by Benedict Cumberbatch.

programme.title: Protests in Africa's last absolute monarchy | Western Sahara: the last colony in Africa
programme.desc: The last king of Eswatini? Reporting on protests in Africa's last absolute monarchy | Western Sahara: the last colony in Africa

programme.title: YouTube kids: how unboxing, gaming and toy reviews took over
programme.desc: Being a YouTuber is now the most popular aspiration for children today, according to a survey. In 2018, the site’s highest earner was a seven-year-old American toy reviewer.

programme.title: I was a terrorist - now I run a kindergarten | Finland the best place in the world to be a parent?
programme.desc: I was a terrorist - now I run a kindergarten | Is Finland the best place in the world to be a parent?

programme.title: The imams, the Taliban and the condom | The Black Panthers still in prison after 46 years
programme.desc: The imams, the Taliban and the condom | The Black Panthers still in prison after 46 years, will they ever be set free?

programme.desc: Run the code: is algorave the future of dance music? | The black art: wet plate collodion photography

programme.title: 'Revenge pornography': Chrissy Chambers' search for justice

programme.desc: Should robots have faces? | Are computers killing the mystery of chess?

programme.title: World Cup Slaves
programme.desc: Nepalese men employed in Qatar's construction industry tell Robert Booth how they work for little or no pay as they build the infrastructure ahead of the 2022 football World Cup.

programme.title: Garth Nix answers your questions: on JRR Tolkien, gaming and pronouncing characters' names
programme.desc: In an ongoing series, Guardian Australia is getting kids and young adults to do the hard work instead of us – by interviewing their favourite authors.

programme.title: Murder, corruption and cattle barons in Kenya | Finding Ashley
programme.desc: Murder, corruption and cattle barons in Kenya | Finding Ashley: a Native American family's desperate search for their missing relative

programme.title: Justice for Adama: the family protesting against police brutality in France
programme.desc: Adama Traoré died in police custody last year. His family’s struggle for justice has put police brutality back under the spotlight in France, and his older sister Assa is leading the battle to find out the truth about his death.

programme.title: Weight of the World

programme.title: The Pegasus project

programme.title: Trapped in a city of a thousand mountains

programme.title: Pretty radical: a young woman's journey into the heart of Poland's far right
programme.desc: We follow 19-year-old Paulina, who joins Poland’s far-right National Radical Camp.

programme.title: The captain rescuing migrants in the Mediterranean during the Covid-19 pandemic
programme.desc: Savvas Kourepinis is the captain of the Astral, a humanitarian boat patrolling the Mediterranean Sea to rescue people attempting to cross the main maritime route from north Africa to Europe.

programme.title: Working nights to pack your California strawberries, working days to graduate from school
programme.desc: Ashley Solis is a Mexican American teenager, farmworker and factory worker who dreams of being the first in her family to graduate from high school and go to college. Her mother is undocumented, and like many families with mixed documented status, they face the threat of family separation.

programme.title: Biz Talk
programme.desc: A groundbreaking 30-minute interview show, giving an in-depth look into how top companies around the world conduct business and how policymakers view the fast-changing world economy. It presents 360 degree profiles of industry movers and shakers, tech mavericks and policymakers, and drills down on the stories behind their success, to give you clarity on what’s happening in every facet of business.

programme.title: Travelogue
programme.desc: Travelogue is a 30-minute travel program. Through the journeys of our intrepid hosts, we experience the beauty, culture and mystery of China, discovering how people live in this vast country and showcasing China's transformation to the world.

programme.title: The World Today
programme.desc: The World Today is the core rolling service of CGTN. keep viewers up-to-date with all the world's top stories as they happen.

programme.title: The Agenda
programme.desc: A weekly talk-show looking beyond the headlines and “accepted wisdom” to find the real story. Hosted by award-winning journalist and presenter Stephen Cole, The Agenda quite simply sets The Agenda . You won’t find the same-old talking heads recycling platitudes; instead thought-provoking guests to debate and explore key issues of today’s world. Using virtual reality graphics to bring subjects to life, Stephen will navigate through subjects ranging from “Prove That Climate Change Exists” to “Who Will Win the Race to Space”. Opposing views will be given opportunity to flourish and develop into a meaningful conversation.

programme.title: The World Today
programme.desc: The World Today is the core rolling service of CGTN. keep viewers up-to-date with all the world's top stories as they happen.

programme.title: Leaders Talk
programme.desc: Leaders Talk is China Media Group’s new current affairs program featuring one-on-one interviews with heads of state and high-ranking government officials and heads of international organizations. They will share their insights on the major events shaping today’s world, providing an international viewpoint to understand our times, the visions we share, the challenges we face and the efforts we can make for a better future.

programme.title: Full Frame
programme.desc: Full Frame enriches the lives of viewers through animated discussion of film, arts and culture, and social trends etc impacting a diverse global audience.

programme.title: Today’s Top Pick
programme.desc: Documentaries in this slot are rebroadcasts of our most-viewed and most popular stories of the season. They feature important social, economic, environmental or other policy-driven issues, affecting lives nationwide or simply in one small village. A broad selection of top productions by Chinese top documentary producers.

programme.title: Humanities and Geography
programme.desc: A strand devoted to the nature and wildlife of China, the people who lived alongside them, and the great and diverse landscapes with which they all contend.

programme.title: Living China
programme.desc: Real life stories told from the personal perspective. Moving, dramatic, sorrows and joys, expressed emphatically and expressed quietly. Watch closely to see and understand the real China as it is lived.

programme.title: Special Edition
programme.desc: Prestige Chinese documentary production, tackling serious subjects with the best cinematography, editing, and all round production values with a unique Chinese perspective.

programme.title: Journeys and Discoveries
programme.desc: A documentary series showcasing the history of China and its people.

programme.title: History in the Frame
programme.desc: A documentary series featuring historical and archaeological exploration.

programme.title: Best Eats
programme.desc: Food connects people! A feast for the eyes that spotlights the cuisines of China in a way that’s bound to set the mouths of the whole globe watering!

programme.title: Youthful China
programme.desc: The youth of a country is the future of that country. A series of documentaries focusing on the younger generation of China in which you get to see what they are achieving and what makes them tick!

programme.title: Pixel Collage
programme.desc: A well-crafted collage of selected short documentaries telling stories about all aspects of China! People, technology, culture, and wildlife, all are showcased in Internet-friendly form.

programme.title: Oko w oko z potworami
programme.desc: Cyril bada rzeki w nikaraguańskiej dżungli z misją złowienia jednej z najbardziej agresywnych ryb na naszej planecie: mierzące do 2,5 metra długości tarpony to prawdziwi słodkowodni tytani.

programme.title: Największe pomyłki inżynierów
programme.sub-title: S06 : E09 Największe pomyłki inżynierów S6 Ep9
programme.desc: W Portoryko dochodzi do tragedii: eksplozja niszczy popularny sklep obuwniczy. Trzęsienie ziemi w Kalifornii ujawnia wadę, która może zagrażać wielu drapaczom chmur.

programme.title: Złoto z mroźnej krainy
programme.desc: Poszukiwacze walczą z trudnościami: ich koparka nie może kopać wystarczająco głęboko, aby dostać się do złota. Ray musi stawić czoła twardo negocjującemu właścicielowi największej koparki na wyspie.

programme.title: Ekstremalna pomoc drogowa
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Ekstremalna pomoc drogowa S1 Ep6
programme.desc: Ekipa Clayton's Towing zajmuje się przewróconym 80-tonowym dźwigiem w Queensland, a Wagga Truck Towing walczy z deszczem i błotem, aby uratować przewróconą ciężarówkę, która blokuje dużą

programme.title: Demolka na antypodach
programme.sub-title: S04 : E03 Demolka na antypodach S4 Ep3
programme.desc: Ekipa Greenway Demolition rozbiera gigantyczną rezydencję na wzgórzu, ekipa Masa Demolition — sklep na rogu ulicy, a Gumdale Demolition rozwala wyjątkowo podstępny blok.

programme.title: Australijscy poławiacze homarów
programme.desc: Clive, kapitan kutra Minnamurra, musi postarać się o dobry początek połowów, jeśli chce osiągnąć zyski. W Cieśninie Bassa kapitan Danny używa echosondy, aby znajdować homary.

programme.title: Oko w oko z potworami
programme.desc: Cyril bada rzeki w nikaraguańskiej dżungli z misją złowienia jednej z najbardziej agresywnych ryb na naszej planecie: mierzące do 2,5 metra długości tarpony to prawdziwi słodkowodni tytani.

programme.title: Gruchoty - reaktywacja
programme.desc: Sera to samochód koncepcyjny, ze skrzydłowymi drzwiami i szklanym dachem w stylu lat 50. Jest też niezwykle rzadki: chłopcy znajdują jeden egzemplarz na chodzie, ale on także stwarza problemy.

programme.sub-title: S04 : E03 Demolka na antypodach S4 Ep3

programme.title: Oko w oko z potworami
programme.desc: Tuńczyk błękitnopłetwy może ważyć nawet ponad 600 kg, jest niezwykle silny i szybki. Aby pomóc w ochronie tych zagrożonych wyginięciem olbrzymów, Cyril łapie i znakuje jednego z nich.

programme.title: Gruchoty - reaktywacja
programme.desc: Freelander, niegdyś najpopularniejszy w Europie samochód z napędem 4x4, wygląda dobrze i dobrze się prowadzi — ale egzemplarz, który zdobyli chłopcy, choć tani, przysporzy im mnóstwo problemów.

programme.title: Złoto z mroźnej krainy
programme.desc: Christian kopie 38-tonową koparką do warstwy niebieskiej gliny, która, jak ma nadzieję Ray, będzie kluczem do znalezienia fortuny. Elley i Christian znajdują największy jak dotąd złoty samorodek.

programme.title: Ekstremalna pomoc drogowa
programme.sub-title: S01 : E07 Ekstremalna pomoc drogowa S1 Ep7
programme.desc: Ekipa Park's Towing podnosi przewróconą betoniarkę, Scott usuwa samochód zakopany na plaży, a Clayton's Towing próbuje usunąć przewróconą łódź do nurkowania z obszaru lęgowego diugoni.

programme.title: Demolka na antypodach
programme.sub-title: S04 : E04 Demolka na antypodach S4 Ep4
programme.desc: Ekipa Masters Civil za pomocą dwóch rozdrabniarek przerabia tony betonu na placu rozbiórki, a pracownicy firmy Calora Demolition stalową kulą wyburzają stary dom opieki.

programme.title: Australijscy poławiacze homarów
programme.desc: Kuter Barralee po raz ostatni wraca na wyspę Maatsuyker. Kapitan Danny z kutra William Norling zbliża się do swojego wymarzonego celu: złowienia homarów o wartości 100 tysięcy dolarów.

programme.title: Największe pomyłki inżynierów
programme.sub-title: S06 : E10 Największe pomyłki inżynierów S6 Ep10
programme.desc: Dzielnica New Jersey zostaje zniszczona przez eksplozję w fabryce. Pociąg wpada do rzeki w Nowej Zelandii. Kolejne problemy nękają najnowocześniejszy szpital w Liverpoolu w Wielkiej Brytanii.

programme.sub-title: S06 : E06 Największe pomyłki inżynierów S6 Ep6
programme.desc: Ogromne płomienie niszczą zabytek w Glasgow; powódź dewastuje rolnicze tereny w Nowej Zelandii; w Teksasie dochodzi do tragedii po toksycznym wycieku w zakładzie chemicznym.

programme.title: Gruchoty - reaktywacja
programme.desc: Chłopcy szukają francuskiego samochodu — nie chcą kupować 2CV, ale gdy już go znajdują, nie mogą się oprzeć. Mają pomysł na to, jak zachować jego surowy wygląd, ale nadać mu nowy charakter.

programme.title: Gruchoty - reaktywacja
programme.desc: Gus i Will chcą kupić BMW, ale Gus namawia kolegę na klasyczne audi, które wpadło mu w oko. Jest to początek pięknej przyjaźni: silnik i styl Audi zachwycają ich obu.

programme.title: Gruchoty - reaktywacja
programme.sub-title: S03 : E10 Gruchoty - reaktywacja S3 Ep10
programme.desc: Każdy chciałby mieć klasycznego Forda — zespół wybiera model Orion, ponieważ jest to prawdopodobnie ostatni taki samochód w przystępnej cenie. Niestety, auto ma kierownicę po niewłaściwej stronie.

programme.desc: W samym centrum kanadyjskiego miasta nad jeziorem eksploduje pociąg z ropą naftową. Co spowodowało potężną eksplozję, która zdewastowała wiejskie miasteczko w Nebrasce?

programme.title: Największe pomyłki inżynierów
programme.sub-title: S06 : E08 Największe pomyłki inżynierów S6 Ep8
programme.desc: Ogromny lej krasowy pochłania furgonetkę w Nowym Jorku. Potężna eksplozja wstrząsa przedmieściami San Juan w Puerto Rico. Trzęsienie ziemi niszczy biurowiec w Wellington, stolicy Nowej Zelandii.

programme.title: Ekstremalna pomoc drogowa
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Ekstremalna pomoc drogowa S1 Ep4
programme.desc: Ekipa Parks Towing ma problem z ciężarówką z farbą. Clayton's Towing stara się uratować tonącą łódź mieszkalną, a North Coast Towing próbuje odholować uszkodzony ciągnik w górę stromego wąwozu.

programme.title: Ekstremalna pomoc drogowa
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Ekstremalna pomoc drogowa S1 Ep5
programme.desc: Ekipa Truckworks ponownie otwiera główną drogę dla ciężarówek do kopalni Olympic Dam, Wagga Truck Towing ma problem z 32-tonową koparką, a szef Tow Scott zleca trudne zadanie praktykantowi Dylanowi.

programme.title: Ekstremalna pomoc drogowa
programme.sub-title: S01 : E07 Ekstremalna pomoc drogowa S1 Ep7
programme.desc: Ekipa Park's Towing podnosi przewróconą betoniarkę, Scott usuwa samochód zakopany na plaży, a Clayton's Towing próbuje usunąć przewróconą łódź do nurkowania z obszaru lęgowego diugoni.

programme.title: Nefrytowa gorączka
programme.sub-title: S07 : E10 Bez pracy nie ma nefrytu
programme.desc: Ekipa wydobywa nefryt ze złoża J, ale duża dziura w drodze zagraża całej operacji. Larry znajduje nowy sposób na szybkie pieniądze, ale wkrótce odkrywa, że nic nie jest takie proste, jak się wydawało.

programme.title: Złoto z mroźnej krainy
programme.desc: Sześcioro nieznajomych z całych Stanów Zjednoczonych wyrusza na misję życia w niegościnne rejony Grenlandii. Czy zdołają pokonać przeszkody i osiągnąć swoje cele, zanim zima uniemożliwi im pracę?

programme.title: Złoto z mroźnej krainy
programme.desc: Poszukiwacze złota zdają sobie sprawę, że surowe środowisko Grenlandii jest ogromnym wyzwaniem. Sprzęt okazuje się nieodpowiedni, a Ray zaczyna się zastanawiać, czy podjął słuszną decyzję.

programme.title: Złoto z mroźnej krainy
programme.desc: Poszukiwacze walczą z trudnościami: ich koparka nie może kopać wystarczająco głęboko, aby dostać się do złota. Ray musi stawić czoła twardo negocjującemu właścicielowi największej koparki na wyspie.

programme.title: Złoto z mroźnej krainy
programme.desc: Christian kopie 38-tonową koparką do warstwy niebieskiej gliny, która, jak ma nadzieję Ray, będzie kluczem do znalezienia fortuny. Elley i Christian znajdują największy jak dotąd złoty samorodek.

programme.title: Największe pomyłki inżynierów
programme.sub-title: S06 : E08 Największe pomyłki inżynierów S6 Ep8
programme.desc: Ogromny lej krasowy pochłania furgonetkę w Nowym Jorku. Potężna eksplozja wstrząsa przedmieściami San Juan w Puerto Rico. Trzęsienie ziemi niszczy biurowiec w Wellington, stolicy Nowej Zelandii.

programme.title: Największe pomyłki inżynierów
programme.sub-title: S06 : E09 Największe pomyłki inżynierów S6 Ep9
programme.desc: W Portoryko dochodzi do tragedii: eksplozja niszczy popularny sklep obuwniczy. Trzęsienie ziemi w Kalifornii ujawnia wadę, która może zagrażać wielu drapaczom chmur.

programme.title: Największe pomyłki inżynierów
programme.sub-title: S06 : E10 Największe pomyłki inżynierów S6 Ep10
programme.desc: Dzielnica New Jersey zostaje zniszczona przez eksplozję w fabryce. Pociąg wpada do rzeki w Nowej Zelandii. Kolejne problemy nękają najnowocześniejszy szpital w Liverpoolu w Wielkiej Brytanii.

programme.title: Gruchoty z kanadyjskiej głuszy
programme.desc: Glen i Bill uruchamiają firmę Wreckless Restorations, ale spierają się o terminy. Peter i Jason podejmują się odbudowy maszyny pokrytej błotem, której czyszczenie nie idzie tak dobrze, jak oczekiwali.

programme.title: Oko w oko z potworami
programme.desc: Po spotkaniu z młodym rybakiem, który został pogryziony przez wielką barakudę, Cyril wyrusza w podróż po Florida Keys, by odnaleźć tę zębatą torpedę i dowiedzieć się o niej jak najwięcej.

programme.title: Oko w oko z potworami
programme.desc: Głęboko w ciemnych wodach w amazońskiej dżungli żyje zębate stworzenie: ryba-wampir. Aby wytropić tego potwornie wyglądającego drapieżnika, Cyril wyrusza na wyprawę, która wystawi go na ciężką próbę.

programme.title: Oko w oko z potworami
programme.desc: Cyril wyrusza na niebezpieczne bagna i dzikie wybrzeża Luizjany, by wytropić dwa drapieżniki polujące w mętnych wodach — ogromnego rekina i opancerzoną niszczukę krokodylą.

programme.title: Oko w oko z potworami
programme.desc: Cyril bada rzeki w nikaraguańskiej dżungli z misją złowienia jednej z najbardziej agresywnych ryb na naszej planecie: mierzące do 2,5 metra długości tarpony to prawdziwi słodkowodni tytani.

programme.title: Oko w oko z potworami
programme.desc: Tuńczyk błękitnopłetwy może ważyć nawet ponad 600 kg, jest niezwykle silny i szybki. Aby pomóc w ochronie tych zagrożonych wyginięciem olbrzymów, Cyril łapie i znakuje jednego z nich.

programme.title: Australijscy poławiacze homarów
programme.desc: Pozostało już tylko dziesięć tygodni do zakończenia zimowego sezonu połowu homarów. To ostatnia szansa na zarobienie pieniędzy — potem trzeba będzie czekać na wiosnę i nowy sezon.

programme.title: Australijscy poławiacze homarów
programme.desc: Zimowy sezon na homary trwa. Squizzy, kapitan kutra Bold Contender, działa pod presją, chcąc zrealizować specjalne zamówienie. Danny, kapitan Williama Norlinga, łowi w Cieśninie Bassa.

programme.title: Australijscy poławiacze homarów
programme.desc: Kapitan Squizzy ciężko pracuje, aby zrealizować zamówienie na 200 kilogramów homarów. Kapitan Warren ma już 300 kilo dużych, czerwonych homarów — ale dobra passa nie będzie trwała wiecznie.

programme.title: Australijscy poławiacze homarów
programme.desc: Clive, kapitan kutra Minnamurra, musi postarać się o dobry początek połowów, jeśli chce osiągnąć zyski. W Cieśninie Bassa kapitan Danny używa echosondy, aby znajdować homary.

programme.title: Australijscy poławiacze homarów
programme.desc: Kuter Barralee po raz ostatni wraca na wyspę Maatsuyker. Kapitan Danny z kutra William Norling zbliża się do swojego wymarzonego celu: złowienia homarów o wartości 100 tysięcy dolarów.

programme.title: Nefrytowa gorączka
programme.sub-title: S07 : E10 Bez pracy nie ma nefrytu
programme.desc: Ekipa wydobywa nefryt ze złoża J, ale duża dziura w drodze zagraża całej operacji. Larry znajduje nowy sposób na szybkie pieniądze, ale wkrótce odkrywa, że nic nie jest takie proste, jak się wydawało.

programme.title: Złoto z mroźnej krainy

programme.title: Górscy cieśle
programme.desc: Gdy sezon zbliża się ku końcowi, Curzelowie budują panoramiczną saunę na prośbę swoich żon i kończą swoje ostatnie projekty, gotowi odpocząć i zregenerować siły przed nadchodzącymi wyzwaniami.

programme.title: Demolka na antypodach
programme.sub-title: S04 : E01 Demolka na antypodach S4 Ep1
programme.desc: Lady Penelope i jej ekipa burzą wielką rezydencję. Pracownicy Masters Civil rozbierają fabrykę na tętniącym życiem terenie przemysłowym, a firma Logan City Demolitions toczy walkę ze starym budynkiem.

programme.title: Demolka na antypodach
programme.sub-title: S04 : E02 Demolka na antypodach S4 Ep2
programme.desc: Pete i jego ekipa zajmują się domem szeregowym, ekipa Watkins Demolition rozbiera starą linię produkcyjną, a Deno i chłopaki z Greenway Demolition wyburzają dom w Queensland.

programme.title: Demolka na antypodach
programme.sub-title: S04 : E03 Demolka na antypodach S4 Ep3
programme.desc: Ekipa Greenway Demolition rozbiera gigantyczną rezydencję na wzgórzu, ekipa Masa Demolition — sklep na rogu ulicy, a Gumdale Demolition rozwala wyjątkowo podstępny blok.

programme.title: Captured: Extreme Weather
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Captured: Extreme Weather | Dangerous Skies
programme.desc: Mother Nature unleashes some of her most deadly forces to wreak havoc in the air and unexpectedly terrify her victims.

programme.title: Captured: Extreme Weather
programme.sub-title: S01 : E10 Captured: Extreme Weather | Fire & Water
programme.desc: A narrow escape from a raging wildfire – a dramatic encounter with a mudslide - the jaw-dropping images of a flash flood – just some of the encounters with two of nature’s most destructive forces caught on camera in this Fire and Water episode.

programme.sub-title: S02 : E03 WS Viral Wild | Ep. 2.3
programme.desc: Our ability to bond with any and all furry friends is what makes us human.

programme.desc: Storm Chaser Jaclyn Whittal anxiously experiences her first Category 4 Tropical Storm.

programme.desc: Mark hikes up Mount Washington, New Hampshire, the highest peak in the Northeastern US and battles one of the most dangerous mountains in the world at its peak intensity.

programme.title: Hellfire Heroes
programme.desc: Firefighters race to rescue a trapped child; a truck loaded with flammable welding tanks burns out of control.

programme.sub-title: S02 : E08 Alaska's Ultimate Bush Pilots | On Thin Ice
programme.desc: On a rare day off, Josiah and his friends white water raft where few have gone before - on top of the massive Knik Glacier.

programme.title: Alaska's Ultimate Bush Pilots
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Alaska's Ultimate Bush Pilots | Meet Island Air
programme.desc: Alaskan bush pilots risk everything to save hunters struggling to stay alive in a remote area of Kodiak.

programme.sub-title: S01 : E08 Fight To Survive | Adrift Part 2
programme.desc: Facing starvation, dehydration and predators from the deep, sailor Steven Callahan fights to survive not only the physical hardships, but also the mental and emotional strain of being adrift and alone in a disintegrating life raft.

programme.title: Fight to Survive

programme.title: Storm Hunters
programme.sub-title: S01 : E18 Storm Hunters | 1000 Year Storm
programme.desc: The Stormhunters find themselves knee deep in flood waters as historic rainfall threatens to wash them away.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: The “Angry Planet” team hopes to film the natural wonders and extreme phenomena of this fascinating Central Asian country, including a spectacularly burning crater of natural gas, underground lakes, sandstorms and remnants of the dinosaurs.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.sub-title: S02 : E05 Angry Planet | Hot and Cold Crystals
programme.desc: 300 feet from a pocket of molten magma is a chamber filled with giant blue and pink crystals as 60 feet long!

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.sub-title: S02 : E01 Angry Planet | Wild Water Two
programme.desc: One of the most exciting episodes of season one is “Wild Water” – our look at Great White Sharks, water-filled caves and high voltage marine action.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.sub-title: S02 : E04 Angry Planet | B.C. Caving
programme.desc: In the porous limestone of Canada’s West Coast, great forces are at work under the ground, building and eroding the underground into fantastic shapes. In this episode we’ll witness George’s explorations of these massive underground cave systems.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: George surfs with the “Hawaian Fire” firefighters.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: We hope Season Two will give us the opportunity to make the quintessential Angry Planet show – a full episode exploring a major hurricane that makes landfall in Florida or the Carolinas.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: Definitely our wildest episode so far. Here’s the deal: Mt. Elgon is an 14,000 foot volcano in eastern Kenya. We propose a safari/ascent of the dormant volcano. Here’s the first kicker: High on the the flanks of the volcano is Kitum Cave – a cave created by the most unique form of erosion – Elephant Erosion. For millennia elephants have been going into the cave to carve it out with their tusks in order to eat the salty rock. Here’s the second kicker: the cave is thought to be the home of the Ebola Marberg virus – the world’s most deadly virus. So here’s the plan: We are going enter the cave, at night, wearing full Bio-Hazard suits to protect us from the virus.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.sub-title: S02 : E02 Angry Planet | Hottest & Coldest
programme.desc: George experiences the most extreme climates in North America. First he visits the hottest place on the continent – Death Valley, then the coldest – Snag, Yukon.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: Definitely our wildest episode so far. Here’s the deal: Mt. Elgon is an 14,000 foot volcano in eastern Kenya. We propose a safari/ascent of the dormant volcano. Here’s the first kicker: High on the the flanks of the volcano is Kitum Cave – a cave created by the most unique form of erosion – Elephant Erosion. For millennia elephants have been going into the cave to carve it out with their tusks in order to eat the salty rock. Here’s the second kicker: the cave is thought to be the home of the Ebola Marberg virus – the world’s most deadly virus. So here’s the plan: We are going enter the cave, at night, wearing full Bio-Hazard suits to protect us from the virus.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.sub-title: S02 : E02 Angry Planet | Hottest & Coldest
programme.desc: George experiences the most extreme climates in North America. First he visits the hottest place on the continent – Death Valley, then the coldest – Snag, Yukon.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.sub-title: S01 : E07 Angry Planet | Volcanic Wedding
programme.desc: Host George Kourounis has braved many terrifying phenomena – but none as frightening as the one he takes on in this episode: marriage! To make sure his new bride is on the same adventurous page with him, he proposes to get married on the lip of an exploding volcano, on the South Pacific island of Tanna, in Vanuatu. Before the native preacher, dressed in grass skirt and kustom garb, gets to perform the smoky vows, George descends into the erupting volcano to bring out red hot samples of the lava it is producing.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: Mount Washington, New Hampshire has the dubious title of being home to the world’s worst weather. The highest wind ever recorded on the planet – 231 miles per hour – was recorded at its mountaintop observatory. To prepare for a mid-winter assault on the summit, Angry Planet host George Kourounis becomes a “human popsicle”, encased in ice in at the National Resarch Council’s high speed wind tunnel. Then he and his sidekick Mark Robinson climb to the top of the mountain in mid-January and brave their way into a summit blizzard.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.sub-title: S01 : E13 Angry Planet | Midwest Stormfest
programme.desc: George returns to “Tornado Alley” with 3 fellow stormchasers to see what the 2007 Storm Season will bring.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Angry Planet | Desert Monsoon
programme.desc: Host/adventurer George Kourounis explores the American Southwest during the Desert Monsoon. He ups the danger factor by traveling with wild atheist shock-jock R.J. Evans to track massive lightning storms which can produce bolts of up to one hundred million volts. The pair come close - too close - to dangerous electrical clouds swirling over Tucson, Sedona and Monument Valley.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Angry Planet | The Winds of Autumn
programme.desc: The autumn of 2006 brings hurricanes to the North Atlantic and hot dry winds fan forest fires across Northern Ontario. Host/adventurer George Kourounis has traveled to some awesome hurricanes, including Rita and Katrina, with his pal Mark Robinson. This year they stormchase in Newfoundland, site of the hurricane that pulled Mark out of a life-threatening depression.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.sub-title: S02 : E01 Angry Planet | Wild Water Two
programme.desc: One of the most exciting episodes of season one is “Wild Water” – our look at Great White Sharks, water-filled caves and high voltage marine action.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: We hope Season Two will give us the opportunity to make the quintessential Angry Planet show – a full episode exploring a major hurricane that makes landfall in Florida or the Carolinas.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.sub-title: S01 : E08 Angry Planet | Wild Water
programme.desc: George investigates the wild side of water in dangerous class 5 river rapids.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.sub-title: S01 : E11 Angry Planet | Fin del Mundo
programme.desc: Some of the fiercest weather can be experienced at the area the South Americans call the “Fin del Mundo”.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: For George Kourounis‚ ground zero for stormchasing is Oklahoma City, the capital of´Tornado Alley´.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Angry Planet | Fire and Water
programme.desc: With summer wildfires overpowering the Yukon forests, host/adventurer George Kourounis follows the fabled route of the Klondike Gold Rush sourdoughs through the bawdy town of Skagway, Alaska, paddling the white water rivers and the White Horse Rapids into the Yukon. He travels on mountain bike, steam train and Cessna to experience the huge fires and meet the northern fire crews battling the blazes.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.sub-title: S02 : E02 Angry Planet | Hottest & Coldest
programme.desc: George experiences the most extreme climates in North America. First he visits the hottest place on the continent – Death Valley, then the coldest – Snag, Yukon.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Angry Planet | Wild Weather of 2005
programme.desc: George tracks twisters through the Tornado Alley and descends into the Erte Ale Volcano.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Angry Planet | African Hellhole
programme.desc: The Angry Planet team heads to Africa to climb the steep and very active Nyiragongo Volcano in the Congo that erupted in 2002, sending 125,000 people fleeing for their lives. Host/adventurer George Kourounis explores the bubbling lake of molten lava and investigates the risk the dangerous volcano poses to both the people of city of Goma and the Mountain Gorillas who live on the nearby jungle slopes.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.sub-title: S01 : E12 Angry Planet | Boiling Lake
programme.desc: Dominica, the most volcanic and mountainous island in the Caribbean, is home to the Boiling Lake, a large waterfall-fed lake of furiously boiling water. Adventurer George Kourounis becomes the first person ever to traverse across the lake on a rope, risking his life to take water samples and shoot video from a place no human has ever been. He then dives to the ocean floor off the coast of the island to explore vents where the superheated water bubbles into the ocean.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: Avalanche danger is very high in the Rogers Pass area of the Trans Canada Highway in British Columbia. Host of Angry Planet George Kourounis travels with a variety of experts to bring down huge avalanches in the Rocky Mountains. Ski Patrollers throw hand charges to clear the slopes, the British Columbia Department of Highways uses helicopter bombing and mountaintop mortars to keep the roads safe, and the Canadian Armed Forces fire 105mm howitzers at the mountains to bring down the dangerous snow. Still, there are accidents and fatalities in the mountains. We meet Francois Desroisers, an avalanche burial victim who tells a terrible and tragic tale of a mountain disaster.

programme.title: Extreme Weather Countdown
programme.sub-title: S04 : E06 Extreme Weather Countdown | The Eye of the Storm
programme.desc: Lightning strikes, clouds roll, and rainbows fill the sky in this stormy Extreme Weather Countdown.

programme.title: Extreme Weather Countdown
programme.sub-title: S04 : E09 Extreme Weather Countdown | Bubble, Bubble, Hail & Trouble
programme.desc: Tornadoes twist at sea, hail pounds the Earth, and trees topple over on today’s Extreme Weather Countdown!

programme.title: Extreme Weather Countdown
programme.sub-title: S04 : E12 Extreme Weather Countdown | The Speed of Lightning
programme.desc: Thunderstorms come out to play with powerful booms, brilliant flashes, and enough force to take down trees!

programme.title: Extreme Weather Countdown
programme.sub-title: S04 : E08 Extreme Weather Countdown | Slip and Slide
programme.desc: Every weather event you can imagine is making it impossible for people- and cars- to stay on their feet!

programme.title: Extreme Weather Countdown
programme.sub-title: S04 : E11 Extreme Weather Countdown | Waterlogged
programme.desc: Today, cruise ships tilt, houses succumb to blizzards, and wind stops people in their tracks.

programme.title: Extreme Weather Countdown
programme.sub-title: S04 : E13 Extreme Weather Countdown | Storms for the Record Books
programme.desc: Record setting snowfall, tidal waves, rainfall, and flooding all make history in this noteworthy countdown.

programme.title: Extreme Weather Countdown
programme.sub-title: S04 : E10 Extreme Weather Countdown | Rain, Rain, Go Away!
programme.desc: Rainstorms cause mudslides, landslides, floods, and more on this wet episode of Extreme Weather Countdown

programme.title: Extreme Weather Countdown
programme.sub-title: S04 : E07 Extreme Weather Countdown | Expect the Unexpected
programme.desc: You’re in for some wild, wild weather today as tumbleweeds, snow, and lightning all pile up!
